response.original_title: The Color of Honor: The Japanese American Soldier in WWII
response.overview: A vivid, collective portrayal of Japanese Americans during World War II. Three distinct stories are told: the 442nd Regimental Combat Team, the most decorated military unit in U.S. history; M.I.S. (Military Intelligence Service), linguists who decoded Japanese military plans; and the thousands of draft resisters and army protesters who challenged the constitutionality of the internment camps.
response.title: The Color of Honor: The Japanese American Soldier in WWII
